intro: Espeletia praefrontina, commonly known as the Páramo espeletia, is a flowering plant native to the páramo ecosystems of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming growth habit and dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that bloom in the early morning. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and high humidity. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
